content.body:
> <@waldemarh:matrix.org> What does "&c" mean?

Sorry, this is a typography nerd-snipe I use habitually. As others inferred, it's even shorter than "etc", "et cetera", "and so on", taking advantage of & historically coming from a ligature of et, meaning "and" in Latin. There’s precedent but hasn’t been common for a couple hundred years.

content.body: a question from the discourse: should `/^a[^a]$/u.test('a\u{1f310}')` be `true` or `false`?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: a question from the discourse: should `/^a[^a]$/u.test('a\u{1f310}')` be `true` or `false`?
a question from the discourse: should /^a[^a]$/u.test('a\u{1f310}') be true or false?

content.body: at first glance it seems like it should be false, assuming there’s only two code points in the string, one of which is a?
note that this is a u-mode regexp, which matches by code points
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: note that this is a u-mode regexp, which matches by code points

content.body: `true`? Are char classes only speced to operate on u16 chars?
